newsitem.title: CANADA: Bre-X falls on ownership doubt.
newsitem.headline: Bre-X falls on ownership doubt.

text.p: Shares in Bre-X Minerals Ltd fell sharply on Wednesday as questions grew about the ownership of the company's spectacular Indonesian gold discovery.
"I think these (ownership) claims are just the tip of the iceberg," gold analyst John Ing of Maison Placements Canada said in an interview.
Bre-X shares lost almost 16 percent of their value in early trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange, falling 3.60 to 19.35 in brisk turnover of more than 5.7 million shares.
The stock has fallen C$7.55 since October 4, when disputes about the ownership of the deposit became public.
"There are so many theories, different scenarios, permutations, combinations," said Ing, who has just returned from a visit to Indonesia.
He thinks the slide in the stock had just begun.
"We're telling our clients that the cake is not yet baked."
Indonesian businessman Jusuf Merukh told Reuters in Indonesia on Wednesday that he was entitled to a 40 percent stake of the rich Busang gold find through two of his firms.
Merukh also said he signed a technical assistance agreement this year with Golden Valley Mines NL of Australia.
The Australian company publicized details of its agreement with Merukh's PT Krueng Gasui last weekend, prompting Bre-X to challenge its claims to the Busang deposit.
"We've asked the Australian Stock Exchange to ask the company to back up its allegations," Bre-X spokesman Steve McAnulty said today in an interview.
"We've asked for documentation to support the claims and nothing has been forthcoming."
Placer Dome Inc, which said it had its eye on Bre-X, was not worried about the ownership claims, Placer Dome spokesman Hugh Leggatt said in an interview.
"It's not a factor for us. It still remains an attractive deposit."
The company, while interested in the property, had not yet put in a bid, he said.
A bid for part of Bre-X could include a requirement that the ownership dispute be resolved, Leggatt said.
The Busang discovery has estimated resources of at least 50 million ounces of gold. Exploration is ongoing.
Most of the world's major gold producers are said to be interested in buying a piece of Bre-X.
